data.title: Robert Ford (Outlaw)
data.meta_description: Robert Newton Ford (January 31, 1862 – June 8, 1892) was an American outlaw, bounty hunter and saloon owner who assassinated Jesse James on April 3, 1882. In his later years, he performed paid re-enactments of the killing at events. On June 8, 1892, Ford was shot by Edward Capehart O'Kelley...
data.text:
Robert Newton Ford (January 31, 1862 – June 8, 1892) was an American outlaw, bounty hunter and saloon owner who assassinated Jesse James on April 3, 1882. In his later years, he performed paid re-enactments of the killing at events.

On June 8, 1892, Ford was shot by Edward Capehart O'Kelley.

Early life[]

Robert Ford was born in Ray County, Missouri, to James Thomas (1813-1890) and Mary Bruin Ford (1818-1893) as the youngest of seven.

Killing Jesse James[]

On April 3, 1882, Bob Ford, his brother Charley, and James went into the living room of Jesse's home before travelling to Platte City. James turned around and noticed a dusty picture above the mantel in hus home, and stood on a chair in order to clean it. Robert Ford drew his weapon and shot James in the back of the head for the big reward, and for the fame.
